definition: to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: The fortune of the young diplomat began to wane.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻外交官开始倒运了。
约翰可算是个倒运的预言家。

sentences.english: She hasn't been quite so unlucky as she pretends.
sentences.chinese: 她并不很像她所装做的那样倒运。

sentences.english: Nobody wants to have these bad things.
sentences.chinese: 谁也不想发作这些倒运透顶的事。

sentences.english: She hasn't been quite so unlucky as she pretends .
sentences.chinese: 她并不很像她所装做的那样倒运。

sentences.english: Some people think globalization is bad for small nations.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为全球化对小国倒运。

sentences.english: He had his ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 他有过自得之时，也有过倒运之日。

definition: to forward goods/to ship/to distribute/transshipment/a lucky break/change of fortune (for the better)
to load or unload/to transfer/to assemble and disassemble
to tip/to dump by tipping from a vehicle
to load sth onto a ship etc
to construct by hoisting ready-built components into place
variant of 啟運|启运[qi3 yun4]
